page.title: 01An Teallach (The Forge)
page.content: This area is predominantly covered by the mass of the An Teallach mountain range. The lower slopes are covered with rough grasses and heather, alpine wild flowers and base rock with sparse trees. The heights are cruel peaks with gullies of shale. One twelfth of the whole area is covered by inland water lochs, burns and waterfalls. Red deer, ptarmigan, grouse, a few mountain hares and wild goats are among the wildlife. The golden eagle is one of the predatory birds. The area is favoured by walkers, climbers and there is stalking for red deer.
